definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: "An onion adventure" will lead the children into the the wonders of the world.
sentences.chinese: 《洋葱头历险记》会带领孩子走进这个奇妙的世界。

sentences.english: Her ship is crewed by beautiful young maids who geld every male they capture.
sentences.chinese: 她带领着一船年轻少女，阉掉每个抓获的男人。

sentences.english: For ten years, he led his men in the search for the buried gold.
sentences.chinese: 他带领手下人，花了十年时间在寻找埋在地下的金子。

sentences.english: So where does this lead us?
sentences.chinese: 那么，它将带领我们走向何方？

sentences.english: However, up to now, they still respect Nong Zhigao as their hero who led their first ancestors to flee from calamity.
sentences.chinese: 至今他们仍视侬智高为带领始祖逃难的英雄来崇敬。

sentences.english: Dr. Nora Volkow led the study.
sentences.chinese: 博士诺拉Volkow带领了这次研究。

sentences.english: When Japan captured Peiping, Kao led his gendarmes into the countryside to fight a guerrilla war.
sentences.chinese: 日本侵入北平后，他带领他的警察到农村打游击。

sentences.english: Who would be able to steer the team forward in order to stage a comeback?
sentences.chinese: 谁会站出来带领球队前进以期反超？

sentences.english: Senior Pastor, George Tiong, leading the congregation in prayer.
sentences.chinese: 主任牧师，张明兴牧师带领会众祷告。

sentences.english: Cpl. Erica LI and LCpl. Mandy TSE leaded the congregation to sing.
sentences.chinese: 李乐桦小队长及谢敏德见习小队长带领会众唱歌。

sentences.english: Shanghai was to become tile economic engine-room which would send China hurtling into the new millennium.
sentences.chinese: 上海要成为中国经济的火车头，带领中国奔向新千年。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, a certain tradesman was leading a caravan to another country to sell his goods.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，有个大商人带领商队去另一个国家卖货。

sentences.english: Huang Kai was leading ten big boats full of dry straw soaked with oil.
sentences.chinese: 那黄盖带领十艘大船，里面装满浸上油液的干柴草。

sentences.english: The head of the school has since gone on to lead marketing for the whole group.
sentences.chinese: 自此，新东方的校长就带领他们的团队领跑培训市场。

sentences.english: It can guide you around in a city.
sentences.chinese: 他能带领你在一个城市中环游。

sentences.english: All right , now you sons-of-bitches , you know how I feel.
sentences.chinese: 好了，狗崽子们，现在知道我将带领你们干什么了吧。

definition: to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
(idiom) to take on a leadership role at a time of crisis
to conduct/to command/to direct/conductor (of an orchestra)/CL:個|个[ge4]
